name: FetchClickDetailsForCampaign
description:
Retrieve details on members who clicked a specific campaign link.

This tool retrieves information about list members who clicked on a specific link in an email marketing campaign. It should be called when you need insights into which members interacted with a particular link within a campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the email marketing campaign to retrieve click details.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: link_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific link in the campaign. This ID is used to retrieve details of list members who clicked the link.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. Use dot notation for nested fields.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields_list
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude from the response. Use dot notation for sub-object parameters.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: record_count
parameters.description: The number of member records to return. Default is 10 and the maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the campaign.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
